title: Jose Mourinho on why managing Man United has been much harder than Inter Milan, Real Madrid and Chelsea
text:

Jose Mourinho has opened up about being Manchester United manager and revealed why it has been his biggest challenge. 
The Portuguese took over from Louis van Gaal in May 2016, and was immediately put under pressure to restore the club to its former glory. 
He spent big, smashing the world record transfer fee to bring Paul Pogba back to Old Trafford in an eye-watering Â£89million deal. 
But after a positive start found his star-studded team were drawing too many games and throwing points away. Jose Mourinho has opened up about being Man United boss (Photo: REUTERS) 
Knuckling down, Mourinho worked hard with his squad and it quickly paid off as they went on a steady 17-match unbeaten run. 
He then guided the Red Devils to their first piece of silverware of the season, beating Southampton in the EFL Cup final. Manchester United in action in the Europa League this season (Photo: REUTERS) 
Speaking in the above video, which is part of a preview for the Premier League Show on BBC Two, Mourinho discusses his tenure at Man United with Gary Lineker. 
When asked if his current job has been his biggest challenge as a football manager, he responds: "I'm not saying bigger. Real Madrid celebrate Copa del Rey glory with Mourinho in 2011 (Photo: Victor Carretero/Real Madrid) 
"I'm just saying that it was easier to get the objectives at the other clubs than here. 
"I think I have found a sad club." Mourinho lifts the Champions League trophy as Inter Milan boss in 2010 (Photo: Getty) 
In the same interview, the Portuguese also spoke about the mistakes Man United made prior to him taking over as boss.
